title: Fires from Space: Australia
text:
Using satellite data and geospatial analysis, our project explores the patterns and intensity of wildfires across Australia. From the sky to the ground, we visualize where fires are burning and what they reveal about climate, land use, and risk. Dive into our interactive maps and insights to better understand how fire shapes Australiaâ€™s landscape.

Built geospatial models and interactive dashboards (Python, Tableau) linking fire intensity, air quality, and land use, informing climate-risk and preparedness discussions.

title: Fires from Space: Australia
section: Using advanced satellite data and geospatial analysis, this project explores the patterns and intensity of wildfires across Australia. Our interactive maps and data-driven insights provide a critical window into how fire shapes the landscape, offering a deep dive into the escalation patterns of the historic â€œBlack Summer.â€
text: Using advanced satellite data and geospatial analysis, this project explores the patterns and intensity of wildfires across Australia. Our interactive maps and data-driven insights provide a critical window into how fire shapes the landscape, offering a deep dive into the escalation patterns of the historic â€œBlack Summer.â€

title: Fires from Space: Australia
text:
ğŸŒ The Mission
From the sky to the ground, we visualize risk.
Using advanced satellite telemetry and geospatial analysis, Fire Storm explores the patterns and intensity of the devastating â€œBlack Summerâ€ wildfires across Australia. We move beyond simple fire counts to reveal how manageable fires escalated into uncontrollable events, offering critical insights into climate change, land use, and disaster preparedness.

â€œWe visualize where fires are burning and what they reveal about the air we breathe and the land we use.â€

title: Fires from Space: Australia
text:
ğŸ“Š The Analysis
Explaining the crisis through data.

ğŸ›°ï¸ 01. The View from Space
We processed 240+ days of continuous satellite imagery. By analyzing heat signatures over time, we tracked not just the location, but the velocity and intensity of the fire spread across the continent.


ğŸ“ˆ 02. The â€œBlack Summerâ€ Escalation
Our models identified the precise moments where fire intensity spiked.

Key Finding: We uncovered specific correlation patterns between high-intensity heat clusters and rapid, hazardous declines in air quality.



ğŸ˜ï¸ 03. Ground-Level Impact
It isnâ€™t just about the burns; itâ€™s about the aftermath.

Air Quality: Visualized the drift of toxic smoke plumes into major urban centers.
Land Use: Overlaid fire paths with agricultural and residential zoning to assess economic and social vulnerability.

title: Fires from Space: Australia
text:
ğŸ› ï¸ Methodology & Tech Stack
How we built it.







Component
Tools & Methods




Backend Analysis
Python (Pandas, NumPy) for processing large-scale climate datasets.


Visualization
Tableau for interactive dashboards and geospatial mapping.


Modeling
Spatiotemporal analysis linking fire intensity to AQI (Air Quality Index).


Data Sources
Satellite telemetry, government climate records, and land-use databases.

title: Sleep Health & Lifestyle Analysis
text: Class Rank: ğŸ† Top 1% | Role: Team Lead & Statistical Analyst

objectID: Projects/Student Habits and Academic Success: A Behavioral Analysis.html#the-mission
href: Projects/Student Habits and Academic Success: A Behavioral Analysis.html#the-mission
title: Sleep Health & Lifestyle Analysis
text:
ğŸ’¤ The Mission
How does our daily grind affect our nightly rest?
We spend roughly one-third of our lives asleep, yet the factors determining the quantity of that sleep remain complex. Using the Kaggle Sleep Health & Lifestyle dataset, this project applies rigorous statistical modeling to quantify how age, physical activity, and stress interact to determine sleep duration.

We moved beyond simple correlations to build a robust predictive model, identifying exactly which lifestyle changes yield the best returns on rest.

objectID: Projects/Student Habits and Academic Success: A Behavioral Analysis.html#the-analysis
href: Projects/Student Habits and Academic Success: A Behavioral Analysis.html#the-analysis
title: Sleep Health & Lifestyle Analysis
text:
ğŸ“‰ The Analysis
From raw data to refined insight.

01. The Baseline Challenge
Diagnosing the Model Our initial exploration revealed significant relationships, but the raw data violated key regression assumptions. Diagnostic plots highlighted non-linearity and heteroscedasticity (uneven variance), meaning a standard linear model was insufficient for accurate prediction.


ğŸ› ï¸ 02. Engineering the Solution
Transformation & Optimization To address these structural issues, we engineered features using Power Transformations (bcPower) to normalize predictors like Age, Stress, and Activity.

Variable Selection: We utilized Stepwise Regression (AIC) to strip away noise, isolating only the most statistically significant predictors.



ğŸ§© 03. The Final Model
Precision Tuning The optimized model achieved an Adjusted \(R^2 \approx 0.83\), explaining 83% of the variance in sleep duration.

Outcome: Residual errors were minimized to 0.046, creating a highly reliable framework for predicting sleep outcomes.

objectID: Projects/Student Habits and Academic Success: A Behavioral Analysis.html#key-findings
href: Projects/Student Habits and Academic Success: A Behavioral Analysis.html#key-findings
title: Sleep Health & Lifestyle Analysis
text:
ğŸ” Key Findings
What the data says about sleeping better.

Quality Equals Quantity: Sleep quality was the strongest positive predictorâ€”better sleep depth significantly correlates with longer duration.
Move to Snooze: Physical activity levels showed a strong positive correlation with sleep duration.
The Age Factor: Interestingly, age showed a slight negative correlation; as we get older, sleep duration tends to decrease marginally (-0.02% per unit increase).
The â€œDaily Stepsâ€ Paradox: While general physical activity is good, raw â€œDaily Stepsâ€ showed a negligible or slightly negative impact, suggesting that intensity of exercise matters more than just step count

title: Student Habits and Academic Success: A Behavioral Analysis
text: Class Rank: ğŸ† Top 1% | Role: Data Analyst & Visual Storyteller

title: Student Habits and Academic Success: A Behavioral Analysis
text:
ğŸ“š The Mission
Grades arenâ€™t just about IQ. Theyâ€™re about habits.
We often blame academic struggles on external factors like funding or background. But what if the secret to success lies in the small, daily choices we make? Using a dataset of 1,000 students, this project applies behavioral analysis and predictive modeling to answer a simple question: How do sleep, screen time, and study routines mathematically determine your GPA?

We moved beyond intuition to quantify exactly how much an hour of Netflix costs you in exam points.

title: Student Habits and Academic Success: A Behavioral Analysis
text:
ğŸ“‰ The Analysis
Decoding the student lifestyle.

01. The Hypothesis
The â€œHiddenâ€ Variables Most research focuses on fixed demographics. We flipped the script to focus on controllable behaviors.

Input: Sleep hours, study duration, attendance, social media usage, and Netflix consumption.
Target: Final Academic Performance (Exam Score).



ğŸ§® 02. The Model
Stepwise Precision We didnâ€™t just look for correlations; we built a prediction engine. Using Stepwise Multiple Regression, we isolated the variables that actually move the needle.

Performance: The final model achieved an Adjusted \(R^2 \approx 0.90\), meaning we could explain nearly 90% of the variance in exam scores based purely on lifestyle habits.



ğŸ“Š 03. The Visualization
Seeing the Trade-offs We created a visual ecosystem to make the data digestible: * Correlation Heatmaps: Instantly highlighting the strongest positive (Study Time) and negative (Screen Time) drivers.

Comparative Bar Charts: contrasting high-performing vs.Â at-risk student profiles.

title: Student Habits and Academic Success: A Behavioral Analysis
text:
ğŸ” Key Findings
The data-backed recipe for an A+.

The Attendance Multiplier: Attendance wasnâ€™t just helpful; it was the single strongest predictor of success.
The â€œBingeâ€ Tax: Passive screen time (Netflix/Social Media) showed a quantifiable negative correlation with exam scoresâ€”every hour spent binging had a measurable grade penalty.
Sleep is Study: Contrary to the â€œall-nighterâ€ culture, data confirmed that adequate sleep is statistically linked to higher performance.

Modeling

title: DataFest 2025: Commercial Site Selection
text: Competition: ğŸ† DataFest 2025 (Finalist) | Role: Team Lead & Data Strategist

title: DataFest 2025: Commercial Site Selection
text:
ğŸŒ The Mission
If work has changed, shouldnâ€™t the workplace change too?
The â€œReturn to Officeâ€ isnâ€™t just about whenâ€”itâ€™s about where. Using a massive dataset of commercial leases from 2018 to 2024, this project investigates how the COVID-19 pandemic fundamentally altered the DNA of the office market. We answer the critical question: Are companies actually abandoning the city, or are they just upgrading their address?

We analyzed the shift in square footage to prove that the future of work isnâ€™t remoteâ€”itâ€™s hybrid, high-quality, and geographically flexible.

title: DataFest 2025: Commercial Site Selection
text:
ğŸ™ï¸ The Analysis
Tracking the migration of capital and companies.

01. The â€œFlight to Qualityâ€
Class A vs.Â Class O We tracked lease volumes across building classes. The data revealed a decisive split:

Pre-Pandemic: Major leases were roughly split, with Class A holding ~65% of the market.
The Shift: Post-COVID, the share of Class A (premium) leases surged to over 70%. Companies are downsizing footprint but upgrading quality to entice workers back.



ğŸ¡ 02. The Suburban Surge
CBD vs.Â The Burbs We analyzed the tension between Central Business Districts (CBD) and Suburban locations.

The Shock: During the height of the pandemic (2020), suburban leasing spiked to 60%, overtaking downtowns.
The Recovery: Post-2022, the market began correcting. CBD leasing is recovering, signaling a return to equilibrium rather than the â€œdeath of the cityâ€.



ğŸ—ºï¸ 03. The Strategy
The â€œHybridâ€ Portfolio Based on the data, we formulated a site selection strategy for 2025:

Blend Locations: Maintain a core CBD presence for prestige while opening suburban satellites for flexibility.
Reposition Assets: Investors holding lower-quality (Class O) stock must renovate immediately to survive.

title: DataFest 2025: Commercial Site Selection
text:
ğŸ“Š Visualizing the Shift
Evidence from the dataset.
Figure 1: The â€œFlight to Qualityâ€ â€“ Class A leasing volume recovers while Class O stagnates.
Figure 2: The Location See-Saw â€“ Visualizing the 2020 suburban spike and the 2023 downtown recovery.
